title: 04. The First Persian Invasion
description: The Persian invasion of 490 BC and the events leading to the Battle of Marathon.

questions.question: Who were the commanders leading the Persian invasion of 490?
Which island did they invade, and subsequently enslave the population of?
How did the Persians behave at the sanctuary of Delos?
Which city on Euboea sought help, unsuccessfully, from Athens?
Which Athenian figure was helping the Persians in their invasion?
Where did the Persians land their fleet in Attica?
Who was leading the Athenian troops that marched to meet the Persians?
Why was Sparta not able to send help?
options: They were preparing for a festival
They were fighting a battle in the Peloponnese
They were having internal political conflicts
They were celebrating the Carnea festival

questions.question: Which small town did send troops to aid Athens?
Who had the final vote in the Athenian generals' council, and ultimately voted to fight following Miltiades' suggestion?
What unusual tactic did the Greeks use against the Persians?
How had the Greeks arranged their forces?
When the Persians fled, what did they try to do?
options: Sail to the port of Athens

questions.question: Why were the Persians not able to approach the city by sea?
options: The Athenians had marched back and were waiting for them
They were ambushed by the Spartans
The Athenian fleet had blockaded the coast

questions.question: What was Sparta able to do when they arrived?
options: Join the battle and defeat the Persians

questions.question: What was Darius' response to the failure of this invasion?
options: He was angry, set on revenge, and began preparations for a further invasion immediately
He ordered a retreat and returned to Persia
He sent reinforcements to the Ionian cities
He withdrew and made peace with the Greeks
